page.title: 10Tenbury Market 1
page.content: Tenbury Market was built by Mr. Winterton then took over by Cooper Baldwin then Russell Baldwin who owns it now. It is just short of a hundred years old. It is the most popular market to sell{holly, mistletoe and {Christmas Trees}in the West Midlands. The best time for selling animals are when they are ready for the butcher.The most popular cow for fat is a{Charolais}and for milk is a {Friesian}and the{Hereford Cross {Friesian}is the best breed.The best selling lamb is a Suffolk lamb which is bred by a strong{Suffolk}ewe.The best selling pig is the pigs which have lots of fat on their back and a lot of lean but pigs are not popular now.The most unusual animals in the market are goats,donkeys and a Charolais bullock which weighed more than 1 ton and well over{1,000 pounds
